questions.title: Merge K Sorted Lists
questions.prompt: Given an array of k linked-lists, each linked-list is sorted in ascending order, merge all the linked-lists into one sorted linked-list and return it.
followups: Compare the heap approach vs divide-and-conquer.
What is the time complexity in terms of total nodes N and k?
What are edge cases (empty lists, null heads)?

questions.title: Serialize and Deserialize Binary Tree
questions.prompt: Design an algorithm to serialize and deserialize a binary tree. There is no restriction on how your serialization/deserialization algorithm should work.
followups: What representation do you choose and why?
How do you handle null children?
What is the complexity?

questions.title: Word Ladder
questions.prompt: Given two words (beginWord and endWord), and a dictionary's word list, find the length of shortest transformation sequence from beginWord to endWord such that only one letter can be changed at a time and each transformed word must exist in the word list.
followups: Why is BFS appropriate here?
How can you optimize neighbor generation?
What is the complexity?

questions.title: Trapping Rain Water
questions.prompt: Given n non-negative integers representing an elevation map where the width of each bar is 1, compute how much water it can trap after raining.
followups: Compare the DP approach vs two-pointer approach.
What is the time and space complexity of each?
How would you solve if the elevation map is circular?

questions.title: Median of Two Sorted Arrays
questions.prompt: Given two sorted arrays nums1 and nums2 of size m and n respectively, return the median of the two sorted arrays in O(log(m+n)) time.
followups: Why can't we simply merge the arrays?
Explain the partition approach.
What are the edge cases (empty arrays, odd/even lengths)?

questions.title: Alien Dictionary
questions.prompt: There is a new alien language that uses the English alphabet. You are given a list of words from the dictionary, where words are sorted lexicographically by the rules of this new language. Derive the order of letters in this language.
followups: How do you handle invalid input (cycles, contradictions)?
What if multiple valid orders exist?
How do you build the graph efficiently?

questions.title: Regular Expression Matching
questions.prompt: Given an input string s and a pattern p, implement regular expression matching with support for '.' and '*' where '.' matches any single character and '*' matches zero or more of the preceding element.
followups: What is the DP state and recurrence relation?
How does greedy fail for '*'?
Can you optimize space complexity?

questions.title: Largest Rectangle in Histogram
questions.prompt: Given an array of integers heights representing the histogram's bar height where the width of each bar is 1, return the area of the largest rectangle in the histogram.
followups: Why does a stack help here?
What is the time and space complexity?
How would you solve for a 2D matrix?

questions.title: Sliding Window Maximum
questions.prompt: Given an array nums and a sliding window size k, return the maximum element in each window moving from left to right.
followups: Why does a deque give O(n) solution?
How do you maintain indices vs values?
What if k is very large?

questions.title: Minimum Window Substring
questions.prompt: Given two strings s and t, return the minimum window substring of s that contains all characters of t (including duplicates).
followups: How do you track character requirements efficiently?
What's the time complexity?
How do you handle very large strings?

questions.title: N-Queens
questions.prompt: The n-queens puzzle is the problem of placing n queens on an n x n chessboard such that no two queens attack each other. Return all distinct solutions.
followups: How do you optimize the conflict check?
What's the time complexity?
How would you count only the number of solutions?

questions.title: Sudoku Solver
questions.prompt: Write a program to solve a Sudoku puzzle by filling the empty cells. You may assume there is exactly one solution.
followups: How do you choose which cell to fill next?
What pruning strategies can you use?
How would you validate a solved Sudoku?

questions.title: Longest Valid Parentheses
questions.prompt: Given a string containing just the characters '(' and ')', find the length of the longest valid (well-formed) parentheses substring.
followups: Compare DP vs stack approach.
How to solve in O(1) space?
What are the edge cases?

questions.title: Edit Distance
questions.prompt: Given two strings word1 and word2, return the minimum number of operations required to convert word1 to word2. Operations: insert, delete, replace.
followups: What is the DP recurrence?
How can you optimize space?
What if operations have different costs?

questions.title: Maximum Profit in Job Scheduling
questions.prompt: Given startTime, endTime, and profit arrays for n jobs, find the maximum profit with no overlapping jobs.
followups: Why sort by end time?
How does binary search help?
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Count of Smaller Numbers After Self
questions.prompt: Given an integer array nums, return an array counts where counts[i] is the number of smaller elements to the right of nums[i].
followups: Compare merge-sort vs BIT approach.
What's the time complexity?
How to handle duplicates?

questions.title: Design Twitter
questions.prompt: Design a simplified version of Twitter where users can post tweets, follow/unfollow another user, and see the 10 most recent tweets in their news feed.
followups: How do you handle news feed generation efficiently?
What about pull vs push models?
How to scale to millions of users?

questions.title: LRU Cache
questions.prompt: Design and implement a data structure for Least Recently Used (LRU) cache. It should support get and put in O(1) average time complexity.
followups: Why do you need both HashMap and LinkedList?
How would you make it thread-safe?
What about implementing LFU cache?

questions.title: LFU Cache
questions.prompt: Design and implement a data structure for Least Frequently Used (LFU) cache. It should support get and put in O(1) average time complexity.
followups: How does LFU differ from LRU?
How do you handle frequency ties?
What's the space complexity?

questions.title: Word Search II
questions.prompt: Given an m x n board of characters and a list of words, return all words on the board. Words can be constructed from letters of sequentially adjacent cells.
followups: How does using a trie improve performance?
How do you prune the search?
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Design In-Memory File System
questions.prompt: Design an in-memory file system that supports creating paths, adding files, listing directories, and reading/writing files.
followups: What data structure represents the hierarchy?
How do you handle relative vs absolute paths?
What about file permissions and metadata?

questions.title: The Skyline Problem
questions.prompt: Given a list of buildings represented as [left, right, height], return the skyline formed by these buildings.
followups: Why use a max-heap?
How do you handle overlapping buildings?
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Design Search Autocomplete System
questions.prompt: Design a search autocomplete system that returns top k sentences for a given prefix, weighted by historical frequency.
followups: How do you store and update frequencies?
What about real-time updates?
How to handle memory constraints?

questions.title: Candy
questions.prompt: There are n children standing in a line with ratings. Each child must have at least one candy, and children with a higher rating get more candies than neighbors. Return minimum candies needed.
followups: Why does the two-pass approach work?
What's the time complexity?
Can you solve with one pass?

questions.title: Text Justification
questions.prompt: Given an array of words and a width maxWidth, format the text such that each line has exactly maxWidth characters and is fully justified.
followups: How do you distribute extra spaces?
What about the last line?
What edge cases should you test?

questions.title: Basic Calculator
questions.prompt: Implement a basic calculator to evaluate a simple expression string containing non-negative integers, '+', '-', '*', '/' and parentheses.
followups: How do you handle operator precedence?
What about negative numbers?
How to extend for more operators?

questions.title: Longest Increasing Path in a Matrix
questions.prompt: Given an m x n integers matrix, return the length of the longest increasing path in the matrix.
followups: Why does memoization help?
What's the time complexity?
Can you solve with topological sort?

questions.title: Burst Balloons
questions.prompt: Given n balloons with values, burst them in any order. Coins = balloon[i-1] * balloon[i] * balloon[i+1] if adjacent exist. Return maximum coins.
followups: What is the DP state and transition?
Why is greedy incorrect?
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Russian Doll Envelopes
questions.prompt: Given envelopes with width and height, find maximum number you can Russian doll (one inside another). Width and height must both be strictly smaller.
followups: Why sort by width and then LIS on height?
What's the time complexity?
How to handle equal widths?

questions.title: Design a Distributed Rate Limiter
questions.prompt: Design a distributed rate limiter that can handle millions of requests across multiple servers with high accuracy.
followups: Compare token bucket vs sliding window in distributed context.
How do you handle clock skew?
What about consistency vs availability trade-offs?

questions.title: Design a URL Shortener at Scale
questions.prompt: Design a URL shortening service like TinyURL that handles billions of requests with high availability and low latency.
followups: How do you generate unique short codes?
What's your database choice and sharding strategy?
How do you handle custom aliases and expiration?

questions.title: Design a Web Crawler
questions.prompt: Design a web crawler that downloads and indexes web pages at scale, handling politeness, deduplication, and freshness.
followups: How do you avoid overloading servers?
How do you detect and avoid duplicate URLs?
What about priority crawling?

questions.title: Design a Chat System
questions.prompt: Design a real-time chat system supporting 1-1 and group chats, online presence, and message history.
followups: How do you handle message ordering and delivery guarantees?
What about offline messages and sync?
How do you scale WebSocket connections?

questions.title: Design a Recommendation System
questions.prompt: Design a recommendation system for e-commerce or content platforms that suggests items based on user behavior.
followups: Collaborative filtering vs content-based?
How do you handle cold start?
What metrics measure recommendation quality?

questions.title: Design a Notification System
questions.prompt: Design a scalable notification system that sends emails, push notifications, and SMS to millions of users.
followups: How do you handle retries and failures?
What about user preferences and rate limiting?
How do you prevent duplicate notifications?

questions.title: Design a Key-Value Store
questions.prompt: Design a distributed key-value store with strong consistency, high availability, and partition tolerance.
followups: CAP trade-offs: which two do you choose and why?
How do you handle replication and sharding?
What about failure detection and recovery?

questions.title: Design a Parking Lot System
questions.prompt: Design a parking lot system with multiple floors, spots of different sizes, and entry/exit gates.
followups: How do you find the nearest available spot?
How do you handle pricing and payments?
What about disabled spots and EV charging?

questions.title: Maximum Frequency Stack
questions.prompt: Design a stack-like data structure that supports push, pop, and popMax (pop most frequent element, breaking ties by recency).
followups: How do you maintain frequency counts?
How do you handle ties?
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Find Median from Data Stream
questions.prompt: Design a data structure that supports adding numbers and finding the median of all added numbers.
followups: Why use two heaps?
How do you maintain balance?
What if you need to support removal?

questions.title: Insert Delete GetRandom O(1)
questions.prompt: Design a data structure that supports insert, delete, and getRandom in average O(1) time, with duplicates allowed.
followups: How do you handle duplicates?
What's the space complexity?
How does getRandom guarantee uniform distribution?

questions.title: Longest Consecutive Sequence
questions.prompt: Given an unsorted array of integers nums, return the length of the longest consecutive elements sequence in O(n) time.
followups: Why is sorting not allowed?
How do you achieve O(n)?
What about memory constraints?

questions.title: First Missing Positive
questions.prompt: Given an unsorted integer array nums, return the smallest missing positive integer in O(n) time and O(1) space.
followups: Why can't we use extra space?
How do you use array indices as hash keys?
What are the edge cases?

questions.title: Max Points on a Line
questions.prompt: Given an array of points where points[i] = [xi, yi], return the maximum number of points that lie on the same straight line.
followups: How do you represent slope to avoid floating point errors?
How do you handle duplicate points?
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Expression Add Operators
questions.prompt: Given a string num that contains only digits and a target integer, return all possibilities to add binary operators '+', '-', or '*' between digits to evaluate to target.
followups: How do you handle operator precedence with '*',
How do you avoid overflow?
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Perfect Rectangle
questions.prompt: Given an array of rectangles defined as [x1, y1, x2, y2], determine if they form a perfect rectangle (no gaps, no overlaps).
followups: What conditions must a perfect rectangle satisfy?
How do you detect overlaps efficiently?
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Largest BST Subtree
questions.prompt: Given a binary tree, find the largest subtree which is a Binary Search Tree.
followups: What information needs to be passed up the recursion?
How do you validate BST while traversing?
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Recover Binary Search Tree
questions.prompt: Two elements of a BST are swapped by mistake. Recover the tree without changing its structure.
followups: How do you identify the two swapped nodes?
What about Morris traversal for O(1) space?
What are the edge cases?

questions.title: Binary Tree Maximum Path Sum
questions.prompt: Given a binary tree, find the maximum path sum. The path may start and end at any node.
followups: What does each node contribute to the max path?
How do you handle negative values?
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Critical Connections in a Network
questions.prompt: Given n servers and connections between them, find all critical connections (bridges) whose removal disconnects the network.
followups: What are low-link values?
Why is Tarjan's algorithm O(V+E)?
How do you handle duplicate edges?

questions.title: Minimum Number of Refueling Stops
questions.prompt: A car travels from start to target with initial fuel. Stations have position and fuel amount. Find minimum refueling stops to reach destination.
followups: Compare DP vs greedy approaches.
Why does a max-heap work?
What's the time complexity?

questions.title: Swim in Rising Water
questions.prompt: Given N x N grid where grid[i][j] is elevation at (i,j). Rain starts at time 0. At time t, water depth is t. You can swim iff elevation <= t. Find minimum time to reach bottom-right.
followups: Compare Dijkstra vs binary search + BFS.
What's the time complexity of each?
How does this relate to the minimax path problem?

questions.title: Shortest Subarray with Sum at Least K
questions.prompt: Given an integer array nums and an integer k, return the length of the shortest non-empty subarray with sum >= k. If no such subarray exists, return -1.
followups: Why can't we use sliding window with negatives?
How does the deque maintain monotonicity?
What's the time complexity?
